metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15963 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in extensions in Google Chrome prior to 85.0.4183.121 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extension to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted Chrome Extension.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
